activities.description: Informed consent

activities.name: Admit to unit
activities.description: Admit to unit

activities.name: Discharge from unit
activities.description: Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

activities.name: Outpatient visit or phone call
activities.description: Outpatient visit or phone call

activities.name: Inclusion/exclusion
activities.description: Inclusion/exclusion

activities.name: Discuss/document contraception
activities.description: Discuss/document contraception

activities.name: Follicle-stimulating hormone (post-menopausal females only)
activities.description: Follicle-stimulating hormone (post-menopausal females only). If needed to confirm menopause.

activities.name: Alcohol test
activities.description: Alcohol test

activities.name: Urine drug screen
activities.description: Urine drug screen

activities.name: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen
activities.description: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen

activities.name: Medical history/demographics
activities.description: Medical history/demographics. Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.

activities.name: WD history
activities.description: WD history. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

activities.name: Prior WD treatment
activities.description: Prior WD treatment. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

activities.name: Physical examination
activities.description: Physical examination. A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigatorâ€™s discretion.

activities.name: Height, weight, and BMI
activities.description: Height, weight, and BMI. Height at screening only.

activities.name: Enrollment/inclusion
activities.description: Enrollment/inclusion

activities.name: Discontinue chelation therapy
activities.description: Discontinue chelation therapy

activities.name: Discontinue zinc therapy
activities.description: Discontinue zinc therapy

activities.name: ALXN1840 15 mg/day
activities.description: ALXN1840 15 mg/day

activities.name: ALXN1840 30 mg/day
activities.description: ALXN1840 30 mg/day

activities.name: Study intervention compliance
activities.description: Study intervention compliance

activities.name: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo
activities.description: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo

activities.name: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu
activities.description: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu

activities.name: Chemistry, hematology, Coagulation
activities.description: Chemistry, hematology, Coagulation. Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.

activities.name: Urinalysis
activities.description: Urinalysis

activities.name: Urine/serum pregnancy test
activities.description: Urine/serum pregnancy test. Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be started for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.

activities.name: Retained serum sample (safety)
activities.description: Retained serum sample (safety). A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.

activities.name: Vital signs measurements
activities.description: Vital signs measurements. Vital signs assessments and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

activities.name: 12-lead ECG (triplicate)
activities.description: 12-lead ECG (triplicate)

activities.name: Adverse events
activities.description: Adverse events

activities.name: Cu/Mo-controlled meals
activities.description: Cu/Mo-controlled meals. Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.

activities.name: Light exercise regimen
activities.description: Light exercise regimen

activities.name: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation check
activities.description: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation check. Menstruation check is for women only.

activities.name: 24-hour urine for Cu and Mo
activities.description: 24-hour urine for Cu and Mo. For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.

activities.name: Feces for Cu and Mo
activities.description: Feces for Cu and Mo. For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

activities.name: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure
activities.description: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure
